title: How to Start a Nonprofit Daycare

steps.title: In this case, you will create a corporation that provides childcare services.
steps.content: In this case, you will create a corporation that provides childcare services. File nonprofit articles of incorporation with the state in which you are establishing the daycare. You can get the appropriate forms and guidelines from the Secretary of State. [1] X Research source Include the name and address of your nonprofit daycare in the articles of incorporation, as well as the purpose of starting it. Describe who you will serve and how the daycare will be run and governed.

steps.title: The Board should represent the people you serve.
steps.content: The Board should represent the people you serve. Try to make sure that parents make up most of the members of your Board.

steps.title: To do this, you'll need to file a Form 1023.
steps.content: To do this, you'll need to file a Form 1023. This is the form used to apply for exemption from federal income tax in the United States. [2] X Trustworthy Source Internal Revenue Service U.S. government agency in charge of managing the Federal Tax Code Go to source You will need to demonstrate that your daycare center will operate for charitable purposes. Show the IRS or other relevant Tax office that your services are available to the general public so that parents can look for or keep employment. Include your articles of incorporation, information on how much you charge for daycare services, the number of students you serve and your curriculum. If you're not in the U.S., file whichever form is appropriate in your location.

steps.title: Federal law forbids nonprofit daycares from discriminating based on race.
steps.content: Federal law forbids nonprofit daycares from discriminating based on race. You might also want to have a statement of nondiscrimination on file.

steps.title: Your wages need to be fair, but not excessive.
steps.content: Your wages need to be fair, but not excessive. The IRS will require that you not have excessive rates of compensation when you are a nonprofit daycare entity. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Fundraising is an important part of opening a nonprofit.
steps.content: Fundraising is an important part of opening a nonprofit. While some of your daycare's income will come from what you charge the families who use your services, additional money can help you make improvements, hire more teachers and train staff. [4] X Research source Obtain a list of grant opportunities from your local Childcare Resource and Referral Agency. Visit www.childcareaware.org and enter your zip code. You will get the contact information for your agency, and they can give you a list of grants available in your area. Inquire about grants and funding opportunities from your local United Way, Community Foundation and other organizations which give grants. Research your local businesses and find out if they make corporate grants.

steps.title: Once your daycare is up and running, publicize your services.
steps.content: Once your daycare is up and running, publicize your services. Advertise in grade schools and community centers, as well as in local publications and online. Promote your daycare center as a nonprofit organization. This might help you recruit parents who cannot afford private daycare.

steps.title: You'll need to communicated regularly with the IRS and Secretary of State.
steps.content: You'll need to communicated regularly with the IRS and Secretary of State. Work with your Board and staff to ensure all required paperwork and other filings are completed on time to keep your nonprofit status.
